intro: Psoralea pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Psoralea pentaphylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
